alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:12PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of central New Hampshire, including the following county, Sullivan. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding continues along the Sugar River near Claremont. According to local emergency management officials... water levels have receded slightly since earlier this afternoon but the Sugar River remains out of its banks with minor flooding ongoing. While river levels are expected to gradually lower overnight...the threat for flooding is expected to continue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 758 PM EST, Emergency management reported an ice jam causing river rises in the Claremont area. Minor flooding continues. - A locations that will experience flooding include... Claremont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Forecast values represent ice-free flow.
